dt: {bc}any of a genus ({it}Lupinus{/it}) of leguminous herbs including some poisonous forms and others cultivated for their long showy racemes of usually blue, purple, white, or yellow flowers or for green manure, fodder, or their edible seeds

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}lupinus, lupinum{/it}, from {it}lupinus{/it}, adjective
shortdef: any of a genus (Lupinus) of leguminous herbs including some poisonous forms and others cultivated for their long showy racemes of usually blue, purple, white, or yellow flowers or for green manure, fodder, or their edible seeds; also : an edible lupine seed
